Alfredo has been a farmer for seven years. He plants and harvests rice to sell. He keeps some of the harvest for his family's daily meals and sells the rest. Alfredo is thankful because his first loan really helped him a lot.

Alfredo is requesting a loan of P20,000 which will be used to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides for his rice production. He hopes that he will obtain higher profits this next crop season to continue to support his children's education and improve their living conditions. In addition, he will save some of the profit for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides for his rice production.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a hard-working mother who sells vegetables and fish in her village to earn income for her family. She is 42 years old, married, and has two school-age children. Luisa and her husband want their children to earn degrees so that they will be employed someday. Due to financial difficulty, Luisa wants to improve her business so that she will increase her income.

She is requesting a loan of P8,000 to buy eggplant, squash, beans, cabbage, onions, garlic, and fish to sell in the village. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she can improve her business and achieve her goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, squash, beans, cabbage, onions, garlic, and fish to sell in the village.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a patient mother. She is married and has three children. Two of them have finished their education and one is still in school studying nursing. Her spouse is her partner in the retail business. She is now asking for a loan to diversify her business. She is asking for P20,000 to buy soft drinks, liquor, biscuits, eggs, and coffee to sell. This will allow her to keep generating income for the education of her youngest child. 

She hopes that someday, all her children will be employed and earn a good living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquor, biscuits, eggs, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine to ensure the proper growth of the pigs she raises.

loans.name: Marvelyn

texts.en:
Marvelyn is a hardworking mother of four. She is 51 years old and a fish vendor at the public market in San Jose. She lives with her spouse, a farmer. Income from her fish-selling business helped her support her children's education. All her children are married now. 

Marvelyn is requesting a loan from ASKI in the amount of P12,000 to buy milkfish, shrimp, and crabs to sell. She would like to increase her income so she can start a hog-raising business to generate more income. She hopes to achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy milkfish, shrimp, and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 40 years old and has one child. She is a vendor selling pork meat to the people in her village. Her stall is located just in front of the house. She is now asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy more pork and beef meat to sell and increase her profits. 

In the future, she would like to establish a larger stall for her to sell her products conveniently and keep up with all her customers' demand for the high quality of meat she sells.

loans.use: to buy more pork and beef meat to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
At the age of 49, Vilma still hopes to renovate her house that was destroyed by a typhoon a couple of months ago. To attain her goal, she helps her spouse to earn an income. Her spouse is into the farming business while she is involved in direct sales. She sells brewed coffee, soap, lotion, shampoo and air freshener offered to the people in their village. She has been in this kind of business for 13 years and aims to diversify it. 

She is now asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy more quantities of soap, lotion, perfume and shampoo to sell to her customers.

With the family's perseverance and hard work, they are confident that someday they will earn income for the house renovation and achieve economic stability, too.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of soap, lotion, perfume and shampoo to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary and her husband, Borin, have been married since 1988 and have three sons and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Theary is a weaver. Her husband is a farmer; he grows bananas and pumpkins. Theary has asked for Kiva loans several times; she now is asking for another loan in the amount of $500 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

In the photo, Theary was not weaving because the credit officer arrived at nearly lunchtime, so Theary was cooking.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Chantheun

texts.en:
Chantheun (in the photo) is 45 years old and her husband; Savet is 44 years old, live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh and have two sons and one daughter. One has full-time employment and another one is a security guard and another one is in school. 

Chantheun and her husband are farmers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to get work.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina believes that "Patience and sacrifices are the keys to success." She is 39 years old and has three school-age children. She is managing a variety store while her husband manages their corn farming business. The couple seeks to improve their business so that they will be able to support the education of their children who are now in secondary and tertiary levels. Being responsible parents, they want their children to earn degrees and become professionals in the future. 

Josefina is asking for additional capital of PHP 8,000 to buy frozen food, rice, plastic wares, cosmetic items, canned goods, snack food and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that her loan will help them to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy frozen food, rice, plastic wares, cosmetic items, canned goods, snack food and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Venerable

texts.en:
Venerable has been raising rice  for almost 15 years. He patiently manages his rice farming business because it's his family's main source of income. He is 34 years old and married.

Venerable desires to have a plentiful harvest this season due to many household expenses and expensive farm inputs. He and his wife work together to earn a living. He has a happy family that inspires him to strive hard to be able to acquire greater profits. According to him, his income last crop season was used in paying his obligation to traders who have high interest rates, so his income is no longer enough to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides to ensure the growth of his rice crop.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. He hopes to gain additional profit to make his living progressively and to save for the bright future of his only child.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides to ensure the growth of his rice crop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Despite the economic crisis, Mary aims to improve her small variety store to cover her family's basic necessities and to support the education of their three children. With the help of her husband, she believes that they can survive poverty and give their children a better life. 

She plans to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand, but due inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 8,000 to buy cosmetics, tupperware, footwear, soft drinks and breads to sell in her store. She believes that the loan will help her to make an improvement in her business and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, tupperware, footwear, soft drinks and breads to sell

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s tailoring business. He is an expert in making leather jackets. He receives orders regularly from different factories and shops and he fulfills those orders to earn income for his family. With the loan investment, he will buy leather and thread for making better-quality leather jackets to increase his sales and income.

Rehana is an embroidery expert who receives regular orders every month from ladies in her community who are very impressed with her good-quality work.  Rehana has given birth to 3 daughters and a son. Two of her children are studying while the other 2 are not of school-going age yet.

Rehana is very hopeful that her husband will have good success in his business by making positive use of the loan money. In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rehana.

loans.use: To buy leather and threads for a tailoring business

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Due to hardships and lack of finances, Romeo wasn't able to continue his studies.  Instead he became his father's helper in managing their rice field.  Romeo is a responsible husband and father to his two children. He is thankful because his father taught him the farm techniques  necessary for good production of rice.

Romeo has owned and operated his rice field for almost 20 years.  He would like to perform his farm techniques properly in order to increase his yields this coming crop season.  But he can't, due to shortage of capital.  So, with his determination to obtain a higher profit, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000.   He will be using the loan amount wisely, especially in buying fertilizer, insecticides and other farm supplies needed to improve his crop's growth.  Romeo knows that his sacrifices will give him a fruitful outcome which will enable him to send his children to school and sustain all his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and other farm supplies needed for his rice field

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 34 years old, a very friendly and helpful woman.  She relaxes by helping other people, especially the street children who usually sit in front of her business. Annabelle currently has an auto supply shop in her village. After eight years of operating this business, her family's underprivileged lifestyle was improved. She started doing this business as she began to have her own family.  Before, she was a helper in a restaurant, which she wouldn’t want to experience again. This has caused her to become a hard worker and fascinated by operating her business to avoid an awful life.

Annabelle wants to make good decisions in order to gain high profits. With her chosen business, she is very happy for the support that her husband has given to her. They are working hand in hand to save for their future and the expansion of her business.  Her business brings a good profit which she shares with the street children.

Annabelle was blessed with a 3 year-old boy, and she must provide for his needs. So she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase lubricant oil and other auto supplies that are in demand to produce a higher income. She just hopes that her business will meet her expectations for great changes in their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase lubricant oil and other auto supplies that are in demand.

loans.name: Twikenure Group

texts.fr:
Laetitia fait partie du groupe Twikenure, elle habite  dans la province de Gitega.
Elle  est âgée de38 ans .Elle est mariée à Leonidas, un taximen vélo. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, âgés de 3  à 14 ans, dont 3 étudient. 

Elle est vendeuse de charbon depuis 2ans. 

Elle est à son quinzième crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital, pour acheter beaucoup d’arbres afin  d’augmenter le volume de production de charbon à vendre, ainsi elle va gagner plus.

Avec le bénéfice de son commerce, elle paie la main d’œuvre pour son champ, elle améliore sa ration alimentaire.
texts.en:
Laetitia is part of the Twikenure group. She lives in the province of Gitega.
She is 38 and is married to Leonidas, a bicycle taxi driver. They have 5 children between the ages of 3 and 14, 3 of whom attend school.

She has been selling charcoal for 2 years.

This is her 15th loan with Turame. With the loan she is getting from Kiva, she will increase her capital by buying lots of wood which will increase her production of charcoal. This way, she will earn more.

With the profit, she pays for the workforce and is able to eat better.

loans.use: to buy lots of wood which will increase her production of charcoal.

loans.name: Ramuka Group

texts.fr:
Ancilla  est membre  du groupe Ramuka  elle habite à Gitega,  est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée  à Jean Claude, commerçant du riz, de la farine,… Ancilla et Claude ont  5 enfants  dont 3 étudient.

Elle est commerçante de fanta, de riz, de farine,…depuis 11 ans.

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de fanta, de farine, de riz,…à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices.

Avec ces bénéfices, elle va payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, assurer les soins de santé de sa famille,…
texts.en:
Ancilla is a member of the Ramuka group. She is 34 and lives in Gitega. She is married to jean Claude, who sells rice, flour, etc. Ancilla and Claude have 5 children, 3 of whom attend school.

She has been selling fanta, rice, and flour, among other things, for 11 years.

This is her second loan with Turame. With the loan she is getting from Kiva, she will increase her capital by buying a large quantity of fanta, flour, rice, etc, which she will resell to make big profits.

With the profits, she will pay for her children's school fees, the medical expenses of her family, etc.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fanta, flour, rice, etc, which she will resell to make big profits.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is the mother of three children. Her children work with their father in his business making chicken feed. Chicken feed has high demand in the market. Most of his customers are poultry farm owners of the city, who purchase the feed from him regularly. Surriya supports her husband by selling clothes. She offers a good variety of clothes to her community clients and earns reasonably good income every month. 

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her clothes selling business, because she is facing low stock problems these days. With the loan investment, she will buy clothes in bulk and of better variety that will allow her to target a larger number of clients and increase her sales and profits. She has been operating her business for the past many years and is very confident that an investment will be productive for her.

In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: to buy clothes for clothes sales business

loans.name: Turamire Group

texts.fr:
Abraham fait partie du groupe Turamire. Il habite dans la province de Gitega. Il  est âgé de 49 ans et est marié à Evelyne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants, âgés de 5 à 11ans, dont 3 étudient.

Il est vendeur de postes de radio d’occasion depuis 7ans. 

il est à son neuvième crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de postes de radio d’occasions afin de gagner plus.

 Grâce au gain de son commerce, il va  acheter facilement les  biens de première nécessité de sa famille comme  la nourriture, les habits,…
texts.en:
Abraham is part of the Turamire group. He lives in the province of Gitega. He is 49 and is married to Evelyne, a farmer. They have 7 children between the ages of 5 and 11, 3 of whom attend school.

He has been selling used boom boxes for 7 years.

This is his 9th loan with Turame. With the loan he is getting from Kiva, he will buy lots of used boom boxes so he can earn more and increase his capital.

With the profits, he will be able to buy essential supplies for his family (food, clothes, etc.).

loans.use: il va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de postes de radios d’occasions afin de gagner plus

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
A resident in a village of the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia, Houn is aged 52 and is married to a teacher. She now has three children, two of whom are dependents who work in the family business to help earn income for the family. Houn is a rice farmer. For twenty years she has been working in the rice fields to support her entire family. Even with the dual family income, she can only earn about 5 U.S. dollars per day.

Houn is a first time borrower with VisionFund. She is applying for the loan to buy a hand tractor for her rice farm. With this loan, she hopes to increase her farming capacity and get a higher yield so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en:
Yun, 40, is a mother of 3 dependent children. Two of her children are still in school while the last one is under school age. So the family can survive, she has been farming her own farmland for 16 years in order to provide the primary source of income. Her husband is a construction worker and sometimes also works on other people's plantations for a fee. 

Yun has been with VisionFund since 2010 and she successfully paid back a previous loan. The first loan with VisionFund enabled her to expand her business, send her children to school regularly and also set aside some money for the future. Now she is applying for another loan with other two members. She is the leader, and will use all of her loan to lease an additional plot of land to expand her rice farm. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income from the business so as to make a better living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To lease an additional plot of land to expand her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is a 23-year-old young mother with two small children in a village located in the Cheung Prey district of Cambodia where crop farming is the most popular business for making a living. Her main sources of income are from rice farming and cashew-nut selling. She has been in this business for three years. With her current business, she can earn about US $3.50 per day and save less than US$2 each day.

A first-time borrower, Phalla is applying for her first loan with VisionFund. She will use the entire loan to buy cashew nuts for sale. She hopes to increase her business and earn a larger income to better support her family and also send and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cashew nuts to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
A breadwinner for her extended family, Sreng is a 49-year-old mother of 6 children.  Four of her children (three daughters and one son) are dependent on her and are now working at a garment factory and in construction to help earn income to support the larger family. Like other people in the village of Cheung Prey district, Sreng is also a rice farmer who grows rice once per year as her primary income source. She has been in this business for almost 27 years. She can earn about US $6 per day but she is able to save less than US $2 each day.

A first-time borrower, Sreng is now applying for a loan from VisionFund. She will use the entire loan to buy an additional cow for her rice farming. She hopes to increase farming production and her crop yield to earn more income and make a better living than before.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow for her rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
A resident in a village located in the Cheung Prey district of Cambodia, Yat is 32 years old and also a mother of 3 dependent sons. All of her sons are still in school. She has been working in rice farming for 15 years to earn income to support her family while her husband works at others' plantations and also is a construction worker to raise additional income for the family. With this current business, Yat can earn about US $3 per day but only save US $1 each day.

Yat is on her second cycle as a client with VisionFund. Since 2010, she has been able to afford to buy some basic household items, to send her sons to school regularly and to have some savings. Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use this entire loan to buy wooden board for a house renovation. With this loan, she hopes to have a better living place for her family.

loans.use: To buy wooden boards for house renovation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Dorn

texts.en:
Aged 57 years old, Dorn is a divorced mother, responsible for 7 children. Now six of them are dependents working at a garment factory and construction business to help her earn income to support the family. To support her family, she has been farming her own farmland once per year for 20 years. 

Dorn received a loan from VisionFund Loan one year ago and successfully repaid the loan to VisionFund. Since 2010, the loan has helped her increase her farming supplies and set aside some money for the future. She is now requesting another loan.  She will use this loan to buy a motorbike and also to buy a small plot of farmland. This loan will enable her to increase the household's assets as well as to increase farmland. She hopes to earn a larger income to build on some savings for the future and improve her ability to make a living.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a small plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Koeun's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of two dependent children in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia, Koeun is aged 44 years old. She is a farmer who grows corn as a primary business. She has been in this business for several years. To better earn income for the family she also works for others in her village for pay. Now she earns around US $5 each day from her current business but is able to save less than US $2 daily. 

Koeun's group members have just joined with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now requesting a loan with other three members for US $250 each, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer and to buy gasoline for a water pump to carry water into her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more healthy rice and she also hopes to improve her welfare.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for a water pump for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn is 43 years old, married and has six children, five of whom are dependent on her while the last one is married. All of her five dependent children work at family’s farm to help support the family. Sophorn and her husband have been growing corn as a primary business for the family for several years and sometimes they both works for others for a fee to better feed their big family. However hard she has worked to earn a living, Sophorn earns less than US $5 per day and saves around US $2 each day. 

Sophorn’s group has just joined with VisionFund this loan cycle and she leads this group to apply for a loan of US $250 each. As the leader of the group, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and to pay for labor for land preparation. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor for land preparation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 54 years old and is a widow with two children who are 8 and 13 years old. She owns a business selling soap, rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar and so on. This is her sixth year in this business and she works from 6 am until 8 pm every day. She currently employs two people to help her. Marie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying more rice, beans, cooking oil and Irish potatoes, With any profits, she will be able to reinvest in her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: C8040 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 46 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 7 and 20 years old. His business is well organized. In his small shop he sells different goods including juice, rice, soap, salt, etc. He works from 7am until 8pm every day. Jean Paul employes one person to help him, and they have twenty years experience. 

Jean Paul is the president of this group which is called "C8040 Twitezimbere" in the local language. In the photo, he is the first person from the right. Jean Paul has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase rice, soap, salt, sugar, etc to sell. With the profits from the loan, he will be able to build his own house, reinvest in his business, and pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as soap, rice, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: C5689 Ahotujya Group

texts.en:
Claudine is 34 years old and married with five children between the ages of 13 and 15 years old. She has five years of experience, and her business is well organized. She employs one person to help her and operates from 6 am until 9 pm every day. She is the first person on the left side of the photo.

Claudine has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying more fruits and vegetables to sell. She plans to use the profits to reinvest in her business, renovate her house, and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Vyukadukore K B Group

texts.fr:
Juvenal fait partie du groupe Vyukadukore K B, Il habite à Bujumbura. Il est âgé de 35 ans et est marié à Diane. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, âgé de 5 à 18 ans, ces enfants étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (savon, riz, haricot, sucre, pain,..) et la  vente de peinture  depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son huitième  crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et continuer  son commerce en achetant une grande quantité de produits (savon, riz, haricot, sucre, pain,..) afin de gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années il voudrait acheter une parcelle, aider ses enfants  à continuer et terminer les études, assurer les soins de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Juvenal belongs to the Vyukadukore K B group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 years old and married to Diane. They have five children together, ranging from five to 18 years old; the children are all at school.

For the past ten years he has had a shop business (selling soap, rice, beans, sugar, bread..) and has also been selling paint.

He is on his eighth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is going to increase his capital and pursue his business by buying a large quantity of products (soap, rice, beans, sugar, bread..) so that he can earn more.

In the coming years he would like to buy a plot of land, help his children to continue and finish their studies and provide for his family's healthcare.

loans.use: to increase his capital and pursue his business by buying a large quantity of products (soap, rice, beans, sugar, bread..) so that he can earn more

loans.name: Dukerebuke K A Group

texts.fr:
Elie fait partie du groupe Dukerebuke K A. Il habite à Bujumbura,  et il  a âgée de 48 ans .Il est marié à Fabiola. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, âgé de 7 à 26 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Il  est  commerçant  de vêtements depuis 6 ans. 

Il est à  son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital de son commerce. Il va acheter beaucoup de  vêtements à revendre, afin de gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait que ses enfants continuent les études, que la situation familiale s’améliore et sortir de la pauvreté
texts.en:
Elie is a member of the Dukerebuke K A group. He lives in Bujumbura and is 48 years old. He is married to Fabiola.  They have five children together,  from 7 to 26 years of age, four of whom are in school.   

He has been selling clothing for six years. He is on his fifth loan with Turame. Thanks to the Kiva loan he will bolster his working capital. He will purchase a lot of clothing to resale in order to earn more. 

In the years to come, he would like his children to continue their studies and his family situation to improve so that they can exit from poverty.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy a lot of clothing to resale in order to earn more.

loans.name: Senga K A Group

texts.fr:
Radjabu fait partie du groupe Senga  K A, Il habite à Bujumbura. Il est âgé de 40 ans et est marié à Adidja. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants, âgé de 1 à 15 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de poissons.

Il est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital, en achetant une grande quantité de poissons à revendre, afin de gagner  plus.

Les bénéfices de son commerce vont l’aider à payer les frais scolaires  de ses enfants, ainsi ils vont continuer et terminer les études. Ils  permettront aussi le développement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Radjabu belongs to the Senga KA group. He lives in Bujumbura, is 40 years old and married to Adidja. They have eight children together, ranging from one to 15 years old; four of the children are at school.

He sells fish and is on his twelfth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is going to increase his capital by buying a large quantity of fish which he will resell in order to earn more money.

The profits from his business will help him to pay his children's school fees, so that they can pursue and finish their studies. They will also help the family to evolve.

loans.use: to increase his capital by buying a large quantity of fish for resale, so that he can earn more

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es: Elvin de 33 años de edad, de oficio agricultor originario de la Concordia municipio de Jinotega. Se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas desde muy joven oficio que tiene por tradición ya que sus padres y hermanos se dedican a lo mismo. Anteriormente el préstamo que hizo fue para siembra de repollo compro insumos y pago de mano de obra logro vender su cultivo por la calidad que produjo. Ahora esta solicitando este nuevo crédito para sembrar tomate. El crédito le ayudara para cubrir los gastos que requiere sembrar este tipo de cultivo. Espera que su producción sea tan buena como la primera ,tambien quiere invertir en el negocio de compra y venta de ganado.
texts.en:
Elvin, 33, works as a farmer and is from La Concordia in the town of Jinotega.  He has worked growing vegetables since he was young, work that is a tradition for him because his parents and siblings do the same work.  The previous loan he had was to plant cabbage.  He bought supplies, paid for labor, and managed to sell his crop because of the quality he produced.

Now he is requesting this new loan to plant tomatoes.  The loan will help him cover the expenses that this type of crop requires.  He hopes that his crop will be as good as the first one, and to invest in the business of buying and selling livestock.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor to plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is 37 years old and widowed with three children. He has been operating an electronic shop for eight years.  He has employed two people in his business.  Besides, he runs a grocery business to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business with his previous loans.  
Ephantus has requested for a loan of 45, 000 Kenya shillings to buy bulbs, electric cables and sockets.

loans.use: To buy bulbs, electric cables and sockets

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is from the village of Dalaoig, where most of the residents rely on farming as their only source of living. Adelaida and her spouse are involved in rice farming. Together, they plant and harvest rice to sell to traders in their village. She is now asking for a loan to make improvements in her crop output. She is asking for PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

With her determination and perseverance to generate an income, someday, she hopes to continuously finance the schooling of her five children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a 42-year-old married woman with four children. She is a farmer and lives at Dalaoig. She and her spouse have been involved in planting and harvesting rice to sell as their source of living for almost 10 years.

She is now asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seeds to grow.

Someday, she hopes to make the business more profitable so that she can provide a progressive life for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seeds to grow.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is married to Rebecca, a house keeper who sometimes helps him plant and harvest rice to sell. He is well known to be a hardworking farmer in their village. They have been in the farming business for 10 years now. The couple has two children whom they are currently sending to high school. 

Gilbert is now asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) for additional capital in buying pesticides, insecticides, and fertilizers to use in farming. 

In the future, Gilbert would like to keep making better sales and producing good harvests. He also would like to renovate their house soon.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, insecticides, and fertilizers to use in farming.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
At her age of 52, Juanita still aims for progression on her farming business. She owns a half hectare rice field in which she grows rice. She has two children. The eldest has settled into marriage already and the youngest is in high school. She is a widower.

Juanita is now asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to pay for land cultivation and buy rice seeds to grow. 

Someday, she hopes to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur and to provide further improvement of her family members' lives as well.

loans.use: To pay for land cultivation and buy rice seeds to grow.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a flexible woman. Aside from rice farming, she also raises hogs to sell. The income from these businesses goes for meals, allowances, and bills at home. She has two children attending school. She and her spouse patiently plant and harvest rice to sell. They have been in the farming business for eight years and hog raising for two years. 

She decided to borrow a loan in the amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) because she has insufficient funds now. She will buy seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers for crop maintenance.

In the future, she would like to keep diversifying her businesses to attain her dream of educating all of her children up to college level.

loans.use: To buy seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers for crop maintenance.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a hardworking father who aims to become a successful farmer in the future. He is 49 years old and has four school-age children. He plans to improve his corn farming business to be able to continue sending his children to school. Despite the hardships he has encountered in life, he wants to continue his farming business to satisfy his family's needs and support the education of his children.

William is asking for additional capital of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy corn seed, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labor costs incurred in planting corn. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his farming and increase his yields to work out his plans.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs incurred in planting corn

loans.name: Ma. Ester

texts.en: Ma. Ester is a 55-year-old woman who breeds pigs and cattle as well as cows. Ma. Ester is a very patient and hardworking mother and lives with her husband and five children in the village of Cabisera II in the province of Isabela. She has four years of experience in this field. She sells pigs for meat purposes. Her monthly income is PHP 3,000. Ma. Ester chose a very profitable business and the products she sells in the market are in high demand. She would like to expand her business and purchase more animals. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use this loan in order to purchase three piglets and two baby calves.

loans.use: to buy piglets and baby calves for her livestock business

loans.name: Robelina

texts.en: Robelina is a 40-year-old young woman. She is married and has four adult children. Her husband is a farmer. Robelina has a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries to increase her inventory to compete with others and to increase her sales to improve her income. To achieve her goal, she needs to take a loan of PHP 10,000. Taking this loan from Kiva/ASKI will enable her to have a better collection of groceries and satisfy her customers' grocery needs. This will increase her sales and increase her income so she can offer her family better living conditions. Robelina is a hardworking woman. She is so very confident in the photograph for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy different products for her store

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Mary Jane is engaged in the hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is now 38 years old and has two school-age children. Due to the high cost of school fees, Mary Jane aims to improve her hog-raising business so she can support her children's education.  

She planned to acquire more piglets to raise but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that through this loan she can improve her business and she hopes that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a 45-year-old Filipina married woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. Her business is her main source of income and they all depend on her. She’s also paying her children’s educational fees. 

Carolina has been working in metal for the past eight years on a freelance basis. Today, she’s asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva's partner to purchase additional products such as rod and steel that she can use in her metal business. This Kiva loan will help her earn higher income and improve her life. In the future, she plans to expand her business and gain additional customers.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to use for her metal shop business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Through patience and hard work, Flordeliza believes that they will be able to survive their poverty and become financially stable in the future. She is 53 years old and has four adult children. The main source of  their income is through farming: her husband manages their rice farming business while Flordeliza engages in her hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. 

She aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income, but having inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in her hog-raising business. She believes that her loan will help her to improve the business and she hopes that she will be successful in carrying it out.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in her hog-raising business

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion is a 51-year-old married woman with six adult children who live in the village of Cabisera II province of Isabela. Visitacion is engaged in the hog-raising business with the help of her husband. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and vitamins to fatten her pigs. Visitacion is known in their community as a responsible and very kind person. In the future, Visitacion hopes to expand her business to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins to fatten her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Elelna

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 31 years old, married and blessed with two children. To earn a living, she runs a grocery shop. She has five years of experience in the business. Her spouse does farming for extra income. She has been able to access business loans which have helped her to boost her business.

Ma. Elena hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional products such as noodles, coffee, sugar, canned goods and snack foods for her store.

loans.use: To buy additional products for her store

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Due to hardships and difficulties in life, Celia aims to improve her hog-raising business to make it a viable source of income. She is 50 years old and has one school-age child. Despite being a single parent, she has the determination to uplift their standard of living and to give her child a bright future. She plans to educate her child so that she will become a professional in the future. 

To improve her business, Celia is asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in her hog-raising business. She mentioned that the loan will be a great help for her to improve the business and is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in her hog-raising business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 42-year-old farmer who lives in a small village in the northern region with her husband and three children. She breeds pigs and has 15 years of experience in this field. During these years, Editha has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. She purchases piglets in the livestock market and raises them. Hog raising takes about 3-4 months. After fattening the animals, she resells them for income. 

Meat is in very high demand by the people of the community as they use it in everyday dishes. Her business requires a lot of physical strength, and Editha spends most of her time in the open air. Her husband helps her to feed the animals. 

Editha's monthly income is about PHP 3,000 and she wants to increase it. As meat is in high demand, she needs more capital to put into her business to cover the market. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of PHP 8,000. She will use the loan to buy 2 sacks of feed and a bottle of vitamins for her business. She has already demonstrated herself to be a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Perlyn

texts.en: Perlyn is a 24-year-old woman who lives in Isabela with her husband and one kid. She is a persevering and very responsible woman with a great desire to get ahead every day. For eight years, Perlyn has run a grocery store in town. She mostly sells food products and manages to earn a significant income, which enables her to provide for her family. Her business is the only income for the family. Perlyn requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy snack foods, drinks, canned goods, and noodles to increase her revenues.

loans.use: To buy snack foods, drinks, canned goods, and noodles for her store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is applying for a loan for her business. She will use this PHP 9,000 loan to purchase materials for maintenance of her motorcycle business. In the future, Josefina hopes to continue expanding her business. She has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by ASKI and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy tires and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito has been a farmer for almost 18 years; planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. He also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He is now 48 years old, and has three school-age children. He plans to educate all of his children to give them a better life. To work out his plan, he aims to improve his hog-raising business to increase his income, and support the education of his children. 

He is requesting additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins needed for his hog-raising business. He mentioned that the loan will help him to make an improvement in his business and he hopes to achieve his goal someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins needed for hog-raising business.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is a farmer who lives in San Francisco with his wife and one child. Rice farming is what occupies his daily schedule. With the income saved in selling the harvested crop, he was able to provide daily meals and allowance for his child. 

Federico is now asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP to buy urea (fertilizer) and pesticides used in farming. These inputs will really help in ensuring good nutrition for the rice crop and the ability to produce an abundant harvest. 

In the future, Federico wants to ensure a good future for his child, so that is why he would like to keep generating a good income from the business.

loans.use: to buy urea (fertilizer) and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric aims for a progressive life like other people are aiming for, too. He is 30 years old, married and has been blessed with three children. He is married to Jennifer, a housekeeper. To make a living, Eric plants and harvests rice to sell. His wife also helps him plant rice seedlings in their one-hectare rice field that was inherited from his parents. 

He is now borrowing a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow. He hopes this loan will be granted to him as help for the progression of the business. He also promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a farmer who raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He had been in this kind of business for almost 11 years.

Jonathan is 38 years old and is married with three children. He is now asking for a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming. 

Hopefully, he will make improvements on his crop production so that he will achieve his dream goal of providing a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Hamidaan's Group

texts.en:
Hamidaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan investment, she will buy clothes and embroidery material such as beads, threads, embroidery frames, etc., to improve her services and increase her sales and profits.

She is very creative minded and makes beautiful looking embroidered clothes for her clients, so that’s why her embroidered clothes have very good demand in her community. She is confident that an investment will help her get more established in her business.

Her husband is a mason and builds homes and buildings to order.

Hamidaan has given birth to 4 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are attached to the clothes-sewing profession. Her sons operate their business from the shop in a nearby market while her daughters offer their sewing services by working from home.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Hamidaan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, beads, threads, etc. for embriodery business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married to a farmer.  She has four children but only two of them attend school.  Jocelyn helps her husband plant and harvest rice.  Income from the business goes towards meals and allowances for their two children. 

She requests a loan of P23,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides used in farming.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to keep making their business more profitable.  She hopes to give her children a good education and hopes that they earn a degree and seek better employment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Vyukadukore K A Group

texts.fr:
Françoise fait partie du groupe Vyukadukore K A, elle habite à Gitega. Elle est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à Ruhungo, vendeur de poissons. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgé de 5 à 14 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle a un restaurant  depuis  6 mois. Elle prépare et vend des aliments (haricot, riz, patate douce, viande,...) cuits. Au paravant, elle vendait des avocats, canne à sucre, arachide, bananes mûres,…

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de produits pour le restaurant : haricot, riz, patate douce, viande, sel de cuisine, huile de palme,…

Dans les prochaines  années elle voudrait  augmenter les types d' activités.
texts.en:
Françoise, age 35, is a member of Vyukadukore K A Group. She lives in Gitega and is married to Ruhungo, a fish seller. Together, they have four children, aged 5 to 14. Out of them, three attend school.

Françoise has been running a restaurant for six months. She prepares and sells cooked dishes (bean, rice, sweet potatoes, meat, etc). Previously, she used to sell avocados, sugarcane, peanuts, ripe bananas, etc.

She's seeking her fourth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. She will use it to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of products for her food-serving business: bean, rice, sweet potatoes, meat, table salt, palm oil, etc.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy bean, rice, sweet potatoes, meat, table salt, palm oil, … for her food-serving business

loans.name: Sheema's Group

texts.en:
Sheema is 44 years old, married and a mother of 5.  Her 2 older sons work in a factory while others study in a nearby school.  Sheema is a very hard working lady and operates a grocery store at her home.  She sells spices, cooking oils and other grocery items at low rates to clients in her community.

Her husband has a job.  However, his income was not enough for the whole family, which is why Sheema started her business.  She has developed a good reputation in her community for her customer dealings and good quality services.  She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for several years. 

Sheema has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her grocery business.  With the investment, she will purchase grocery stock like sugar, spices, cooking oils etc in bulk, which will allow her to fulfill her client orders on time and earn higher profits.  She is confident of her store's success after investing the loan.  Note: In the photo, Sheema is the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy sugar, spices, cooking oils etc for the store

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso is 50 years old and a father of 4.  He has owned and managed a rice farming business for almost 15 years, and usually earns a profit of P18,000  every harvest season.  He uses his income for food, clothing and allowances for his children.  Alfonso and his wife plan to educate their children so they are able to find a good job someday.  Despite financial difficulty, they believe that they can support their children through patience and hard work.

Alfonso hopes to expand his rice plantation to ensure a higher production.  He is requesting an additional capital of P15,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay the labor cost required in planting rice.  He believes that this loan will help him execute his plan, and he hopes to have a plentiful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay labor cost required in planting rice

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
At the age of 54, Jose still strives hard to earn an income.  He is married to Dolores, his partner in the farming business.  He had been farming for 30 years.   He wanted to improve his farming practices so he is requesting a loan of P21,000, to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

Jose wants to ensure good growth of his crop and hopes to achieve a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita, 47 years old, is engaged in buying and selling a variety of vegetable.  She is married to Joseph, a responsible father, who is a farmer in their village. 

Leonita wants to buy more vegetables for sale.  She is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 to acquire string beans, squash, egg plant and potatoes to sell in the village.  Leonita would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to acquire string beans, squash, egg plant and potatoes

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 43 year old woman who is involved in farming. She has two years experience in this field.  Marilyn is married and has two grown up children.  She lives with her husband Armando and her children.  Marilyn’s husband helps her run her farm.  This is the only income in Marilyn’s family and it brings P20,000 of profit per cropping. 

She is now requesting a loan of P30,000. She would like to purchase seeds and fertilizer which will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna is 32 years old, married and has two infant-age children. Her husband is a farmer and they live happily in a village. They aim to improve their rice farming business to increase their yields and income to satisfy their necessities and save for the education of their children. Despite problems and difficulties they have encountered in life, they have the determination to uplift their status of living.

They plan to expand their rice plantation to increase their production, but due to insufficient capital, Flordeluna is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in transplanting rice. They believe that their patience and hard work will bear fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in transplanting rice.

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en:
Roderick is 42 years old, married and has two children who attend school. 

He has been cultivating his one-hectare rice field for seven years now. Income from this business goes for the family's expenses. 

He would like to improve his crop production so he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

Someday, with hard works and perseverance, he will attain the progressive life he is wishing for.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a responsible and jolly person who is engaged in her hog-raising business. She has been in this business for 20 years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 per head. Norma is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family out of poverty. She is 58 years of age, and is married to a farmer who takes care in cultivating their farm land. 

At this time, Norma is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccine to sustain her hog-raising business. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further grow her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccine to sustain her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Easter's Group

texts.en:
Easter is married and 33 years of age. Her husband has a livestock business. He is very active and works very hard to put three meals on the table for his family. He gets up early in the morning, milks his cows and sells that milk to his community clients for profits.

Easter provides full support to her husband in his business. She provides food to the cattle and also keeps their living place clean.

She has given birth to six children. All of them stay at home and don’t do anything. Easter couldn’t provide them education due to financial constraints.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her family business. With the loan investment her husband will buy a dairy cow that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and earn more profits by selling it.

He has been operating his business for many years and Easter is confident that his business will become more profitable after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is a hardworking mother who has two school-age children. Due to financial difficulty, she is engaged in a pedicure and manicure service to supplement her husband's income. She has been in this business for almost 5 years and usually earns a profit of 5,000 PHP a month that she uses to buy food and provide allowances for her children. Maricris is friendly and would like to win more customers in her village and also in other barangays (villages). 

Maricris is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to buy cosmetics and other materials she needs to provide pedicures and manicures and to improve her business capital. She believes that if she strives harder she will win more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to provide pedicures and manicures

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
To help support her family, for the past ten years Sylvia, a 51-year-old married woman, has been running a piggery business in the village of Union Kalinga, located in the Province of SheIsabela. She earns about PHP2,500 per piglet.

Now requesting a loan to buy hog feed, vaccine and vitamins to sustain her hogs, Sylvia hopes to improve her business, increase her profits, and better feed her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins to sustain her hogs.

loans.name: Merlito

texts.en:
Merlito has been raising rice crops for almost 22 years. He is an experienced farmer, but still the generated income is not sufficient due to many household expenditures, allowances and school fees of his children. He is married with three grown-up children.

According to Merlito, the farming business requires bigger capital, patience and hard work. With his dedication to increasing his income, he is doing some farming practices to minimize his expenses. One is applying fertilizer to his rice crop and spraying it with insecticide. 

Merlito would like to access additional capital to make his rice field more profitable which will enable him to cover all his family needs. He is asking for a loan in the amount of P20,000. He will be using his loan in buying fertilizer and insecticides to improve the growth of crops being planted in his rice field. He hopes to obtain the loan to be able to improve his family's living condition and send his children to higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s livestock business. With the loan investment, he will buy a dairy cow that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and income.

Mumtaz is a housewife and performs her household duties by staying at home. In her spare time she also takes care of the cattle and helps her husband run his business. She has given birth to five children. Three of them are studying while others stay at home.

She is very hopeful that her husband's business will grow with the loan investment and it will help her family to live a better financial life.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for their livestock business.

loans.name: Senga K B Group

texts.fr:
Aisha fait partie du groupe Senga  K B. Elle habite à Bujumbura,  et elle est âgée de 53ans .Elle est veuve. Elle a 3 enfants, âgés de 12 à 24 ans, qui  étudient.

Elle  est  commerçante de charbon de bois  depuis 8 ans.

Elle est à  son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital. Elle va acheter beaucoup de charbon de bois à revendre, afin de gagner plus.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins familiaux : payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants, payer les soins médicaux, acheter les habits, améliorer la ration alimentaire,…et rembourser le crédit.
texts.en:
Aisha is a member of the Senga KB group. She is 53 years old and lives in Bujumbura. She is a widow. She has three children between the ages of 12 and 24, who are in school.

She has been selling charcoal for eight years now.

This is her third loan cycle through Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital. She is going to buy a lot of charcoal which she will then resell in order to earn more money.

The profits will enable her to meet the needs of her family: to pay for her children's education, to pay for medical care, to buy clothing, to improve their diet...and to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy charcoal intended for resale

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married and lives with her husband and five children. She is engaged in agriculture and cultivates her land but her current income is not enough to sustain her family properly. Zenaida would like to develop her agriculture business and get more income.

Zenaida is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase corn, rice seeds, and fertilizer.  Her loan will help her earn additional income, pay for her children’s education, and ensure a sustainable future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is very supportive by nature. In order to financially support her family, she sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She learned about sewing from her mother before marriage and now she uses her skills to help her family survive financially.

Her husband operates a barber shop. He is very good at hair cutting and other services like facials and bridegroom make-up. People from different parts of the city come to his shop for his services.

Razia has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son has a local food restaurant while the second one is a rickshaw driver. Her remaining children stay at home and help Razia is her daily routine tasks.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son's local food selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy crockery and food making ingredients in larger quantity that will allow him to provide better food services to his clients and earn higher profits.

He is very efficient and a hard-working person. Razia is hopeful that the loan investment will help him make his business more profitable and she will be able to put aside some money in savings for his marriage in the near future.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy food-making ingredients and crockery for food-selling business.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie and her husband are  farmers who are raising their family in a village. To earn a living, they help each other in managing their rice farming and hog-raising businesses to satisfy their necessities and support the education of their six children. They want them to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. Despite their hardships and difficulties in life, they have the determination to work out their plans.

Josie aims to improve her hog raising business to increase her income, so she is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Through this loan, she believes that she can make an improvement in her business and hopes that she will make her business a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: C5691 Unguka Group

texts.en:
Rose is 53 years old and is married with eight children between the ages of 10 and 17 years old. She sells  Irish potatoes, green bananas, and vegetables, and her business is open from 6am until 8pm every day. 

She is the leader of this group which is called "C5691 Unguka". In the photo, Rose is the middle of this group. She has two years of experience. 

Rose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more Irish potatoes, green bananas, and vegetables, etc. to sell. With the profits, she will be able to reinvest in her business, pay children's school fees, and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more Irish potatoes, green bananas, and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie experienced college but unfortunately she did not finish her degree because she got married. She is married to a farmer. She is now 31 years old and has two children in elementary school. Aside from farming, the couple has also established a little cafe which offers daily meals and snacks to the people in their village as an additional source of income. She has been managing it for three years now. She also pays a cook and helpers for the cafe. 

Girlie is now asking for a loan for buying ingredients for food preparation such as vegetables, pork, and spices. She needs P35,000. Someday, Girlie would like to be able to keep up with her customers' demand for the delicious meals she offers and generate good income from her cafe..

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation such as vegetables, pork, and spices.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's loading business. He has a donkey cart: he puts goods on it and delivers them to their destination for a fee. His cart has become rough and needs replacement. By purchasing a new donkey cart, he will be able to put heavy goods on it and provide better loading services to his customers for higher profits. 

Saima is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. 

She has a lot of confidence in her husband that he will make good use of loan money and make his business more profitable. 

In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saima.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is 45 years old. She is married and has a 25-year-old son who has completed his graduation.

In order to financially support her family, Rani sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skilful and receives regular orders every month. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current sewing machine has become old and she is unable to use it effectively. She is an experienced business lady and hopeful that by purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to provide better sewing services to her clients and increase her income.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rani.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: C8041 Abifatanyije Group

texts.en:
Vestine is 49 years old and married with six children between the ages of 14 and 28 years old. Her business is well organized. In her small shop she sells charcoal. She works from 6am until 8pm every day. Vestine employes eight people to help her, and they have five years experience. 

Vestine is the president of this group which is called "C8041 Abifatanyije" in the local language. In the photo, she is the first person from the right. Vestine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more charcoal to sell. With the profits from the loan, she will be able to build her own house, reinvest in her business, and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sophoeun

texts.en:
Sophoeun (pictured here), age 35, is a fisherman. His wife, Sokhea, age 35, sells vegetables. She buys vegetable from fellow villagers and carries them by bicycle to sell in a Phnom Penh market. She wants a motorbike to make it easier for her to carry her vegetables; hence, Sophoeun is asking for his first loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for his wife. 

The couple lives in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children: two sons and one daughter.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his wife for carrying vegetables to market.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van (in the photo) is a boat repairman. His wife, Sakol is a chef; she cooks for a restaurant. They have been married for two years and have one son who is a monk. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Van is asking for a loan in the amount of $600 to build a new kitchen because the kitchen is old and breaks.

loans.use: to build a new kitchen.

loans.name: Norm

texts.en:
Norm (in the photo), age 63, is single. She has one niece and one nephew who are living with her in a village near the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her niece is attending school, and her nephew has full-time employment.   

Norm is a weaver. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her nephew to get work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her nephew to get work.

loans.name: Rann

texts.en:
Rann (in the photo), age 53, sells cotton and silk fabric. She buys cotton and silk fabric from weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces. Her husband, Soeurn, age 58, is a rice farmer. The live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have four daughters and three sons. Two are married and live outside the family home, two have full-time employment, one is a soldier, one is a monk and another stays at home.     

Rann is in the process of building a new house, but she lacks some money to finish it. So, she decided to apply for a loan to make the finishes.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Sadeq

texts.en:
Sadeq is a 30-year-old single man. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. To improve his income, he has additional work as a taxi driver, but it is not enough to cover all his needs. 

Sadeq wants to make necessary repairs to the taxi he has such as: painting, changing tires and doors, etc., so Sadeq is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of repairing the taxi and improving its condition. This will increase the taxi efficiency and improve Sadeq's income. Sadeq is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: to make repairs to the taxi

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao (in the photo) is a motor taxi driver, while his wife stays at home and does housework. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers form Phnom Penh City and have three children, two sons and one daughter. 

Mao had requested a loan from MAXIMA to repairs his home, and he had repaired his house as planned. He now is asking for another loan of $1,000 to organize his house and lay and plaster the brick floor and the wall in order to visually enhance it.

loans.use: to lay and plaster on the brick floor and the walls of his house.

loans.name: Eak

texts.en:
Eak (pictured) and her husband, Kha, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have four children, one son and three daughters. Two attend school and the others stay at home. 

Eak sells fruits, vegetables, and fish. Her husband is a construction worker. Eak hopes to help launch a business selling fast food and sugar cane juice for her daughters. Because two of her daughters do not have work and just stay at home, Eak decided to apply for another loan in the amount of $500 to help her get capital. She will use the loan for buying materials needed in the business such as chairs, tables, spoons, forks, and also a sugar cane juicing machine.

loans.use: to help launch a business selling fast food and sugar cane juice

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda who is a 53-year-old woman, is a mother of four sons and two daughters. Her sons work in raising and selling poultry. For the past 10 years, Hameeda and her husband have also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project.

Hameeda is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep to expand and improve the project. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Hameeda is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep to raise and benefit from its products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has a food café which has been in operation for the last nine months. She started on a small scale by selling food by the roadside before moving to a café.

Joyce is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase cooking oil, fat, sugar, fuel wood, and cooking utensils. 

She learned about Milango from her friends. Her business faces the challenge of high fuel and transportation costs. She looks forward to constructing a restaurant. Joyce will save the extra income obtained from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, fat, sugar, fuel wood, and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Aws

texts.en:
Aws is a 38 year old married man with two sons and one daughter. He is employed, but his salary is not enough to cover the family's needs. Aws wants to make necessary repairs to his house such as: painting, changing windows and doors..etc, and to purchase necessary home appliances such as a space heater, stove..etc
Aws is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of repairing his house and purchasing necessary home appliances. This will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair his house and purchase home appliances.

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr:
Mme WENDPAGNAGDE FLORENCE est la représentante du groupe LA PAIX. Elle  est célibataire sans enfant. Elle a 02 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend des  prêt à porter et pagnes depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  grand marché  de Ouagadougou en ville. Ses clients sont  les hommes, les femmes et les enfants.

Elle veut  s’acheter  05 pièces de pagnes et 06 douzaines de prêt à porter pour enfants.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son stock. Elle ambitionne  s’approvisionner à l’extérieur du Burkina  comme au Togo et en  Côte d’Ivoire.
texts.en:
Wendpagnagde Florence is the representative of the LA PAIX group. She is single and has no children. She has two people to support.

She has been selling ready-made clothing and loincloths for five years now. She gets her supplies from the big market in the city of Ouagadougou. Her customers are men, women, and children.

She wants to buy five loincloths and six dozen sets of ready-made clothes for children.

She uses her profits to increase her supply. She would like to get supplies from outside of Burkina Faso, from countries such as Togo and the Republic of Côte d'Ivoire.

loans.use: to buy five loincloths and six dozen sets of ready-made clothing for children

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is 19.5 years old young man who is a university student majoring in Finance. His father is a worker with a decent salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs and also pay the education expenses. 

Alaa wants to complete his studies so he is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future to him and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay university fees

loans.name: C2840Twegerane Group

texts.en:
Marie is 55 years old and married with three children between the age 14 and 19 years old. She sells clothes and her business is open from 6 am until 6 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her. Marie is the leader of the group which is called "C2840 Twegerane" in the local language. In the photo, she is the person on the left side. She has five years of experience. 

Marie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With this profit, she will save money for her future and pay her children's school fess.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Que Dieu Nous Aide Group

texts.fr:
Mme Rasmata est la représentante du groupe QUE DIEU NOUS AIDE. Elle est  mariée  et mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé  a 14ans et  le moins âgé a 02ans. 04 vont  à l’école. Elle a 10 personnes  en charge.

Elle fait la restauration depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de toécin, tampouy et dans les boutiques en ville. Ses clients sont  les habitants de sa localité.

Elle veut  s’acheter 02 sacs de 100kg de riz, 01 bidon de 20l d’huile, 01 grosse boite de patte de  tomate, une charrette de bois et des légumes.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour augmenter son approvisionnement. Elle ambitionne  faire de son restaurant un restaurant moderne  et aider son mari à assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et de leur santé.
texts.en:
Ramasta is the representative of the QUE DIEU NOUS AIDE group. She is married and has five children. The eldest child is 14 years old, and the youngest is 2 years old. Four of her children attend school. She supports ten people.

She has been running a restaurant for four years now. She gets her supplies from the market in Toécin, the market in Tampouy, as well as the stores in town. Her customers are the locals who live in the area.

She wants to buy two 100kg bags of rice, one 20L container of oil, one large can of tomato paste, one cart of wood, and some vegetables.

She uses her profits to increase her supply. She hopes to transform her restaurant into a modern restaurant and to help her husband ensure the education and health of their children.

loans.use: to buy two 100kg bags of rice, one 20L container of oil, one large can of tomato paste, one cart of wood, and some vegetables

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is a 51-year-old mother of two dependent children in a village of the Ponhea Krek district where crop farming is the main source of income. One of her children is a garment worker while the other  one works on the  family’s rice farm. Thorn and her husband have been farming rice as only main source of income to support the family for twenty years. To earn more income to better support family, they both sometimes work for others for pay.

Thorn has been with VisionFund since 2010 and she successfully paid back her last loan. The loan has helped her improve her living standard. Now she earns less than $4 per day to pay for daily expenses. As the leader, she is requesting another loan with her member to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy rice and earn a larger income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Theang's Group

texts.en:
