A farmer in a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, Theang is 33 years and married. She has two dependent children: one daughter and one son, and they both are still in school. She and her husband have been farming rice as a main source of income for the family for ten years. To better feed their children, they both sometimes work for others for pay to raise additional income. She currently earns around $4 each day but is able to save around $1 per day. 

Theang is the second cycled client who has joined with VisionFund since 2010 while her group member has just joined with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now as the leader of the group, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Theang hopes to grow her rice healthfully and earn a larger income to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 21 year old young woman, who is married with two sons. Her husband is an employee in a local small association with a decent salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. Hala and her husband have a small farm where they raise sheep and sell their products. This has been a profitable project. 
Hala is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and feeds and expanding the project. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Hala is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and feeds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a 25-year-old woman. She is married with one son and one daughter. Her husband is a worker whose salary is not enough to cover the family's needs. For three years, Sabreen has been making embroideries to sell. 

Sabreen is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing necessary textiles and thread to make more embroideries to sell. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and thread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his house and purchase necessary home appliances.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is 58 years old and a mother with seven sons. Her husband is a worker who earns a decent salary, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past seven years, Najah has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project.

Najah is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and expand and improve the herd's condition.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is 54 years old. He is married with three sons and three daughters. For the past five years, Ameen has run an aluminum workshop to produce all types of aluminum products such as: window frames, doors, and any design requested by customers. This has been a profitable project.

Ameen is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new aluminum kit in order to improve the quality of his work. This will help him increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase an aluminum kit to improve his work.

loans.name: Eftikar

texts.en: Eftikar is a 23-year-old woman. She is married with two sons. Her husband is a worker whose low income is not enough to cover the family's needs. Eftikar wants to improve the family's income by having her own project: a small store for selling clothes that is located near her house. Eftikar is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing clothes to resell and compete with others. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr:
Cliente de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont tous vont a l'école , elle se lance dans la pâtisserie pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et aider son mari a gérer leurs  revenus.Avec ses differents prêts, elle s'est deja acheté, des moules , un four artisanale , de la farine et les differents condiments pour faire les brioches, le pain au lait.
Elle a des recettes de 50.000 frs a 120.000 frs tous les deux jours, ses prêts ont largement contribues a changer ses conditions de  sa vie de famille.Elle s'est meme acheté un nouveau congélateur de 400litres avec ces benefices.

A l'octroi de son nouveau prêt, elle va elargir son activité en dehors de la pâtisserie ajouter la fabrication du yaourt et de la pâte d'arachide qu'elle met dans des pots pour vendre dans les ménages et pour la fabrication du yaourt, elle loue une place dans une école et utilise les services d'un petit qui vend des brioches et du yaourt dans des glacière
Tres enthousiaste, elle tient a aller loin , atteindre ses objectifs en épargnant beaucoup pour créer a la longue une entreprise familiale

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of flour, 5 trays of eggs, some fine salt, a 50-kg sack of sugar, and some plastic bags for packaging purposes

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Cliente de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varient entre 12 et 24 ans.Elle se lance dans la friperie en 2008 pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et aider son mari a réaliser leurs projets familiales.

Elle a géré ses differents prêts avec succès , elle a fait des épargnes considérables et son commerce a largement évolué, elle a maintenant son propre capital et ne subit plus les ruptures de stocks, et elle a aujourd'hui une capacité de vente de 3 ballots par semaine.
Avec le nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des ballots de sacs  a main des dames et hommes  non utilises en cuir,des ballots de couvre lits, des nappes de table et des serviettes, elle s'est plus spécialisé dans les articles intérieur de maison. 
Au fur et a mesure , elle est entrain d'atteindre ses objectifs, puisqu'avec ses benefices elle a deja acheté une parcelle en association avec son mari, et elle tient a ouvrir une boutique de vente de friperie.
Tres dynamique, elle assiste ses enfants dans leurs etudes
texts.en:
This borrower is a 52-year-old married mother of four whose children's ages range from 12 to 24. She began selling second-hand items in 2008 to provide for her family and help her husband achieve their family's projects.

She has managed her various loans with success, built up considerable savings, and has significantly developed her business. She now has her own capital supply and is no longer subject to stock shortages, and she currently has the capacity to buy 3 bales of goods each week.
With this new loan, she is going to buy bales of unused men's and women's leather handbags, bales of bedsheets, tablecloths, and napkins; she specializes in household goods.
Along the way, she is in the process of achieving her goals, since she has already used her profits to buy a plot of land with her husband, and she wants to open a second-hand goods store.
She is very dynamic and helps her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy bales of handbags, bedsheets, tablecloths, tea towels, etc.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is 46 years old. She is married and has three sons. Her husband is a municipal employee with a decent salary, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past 10 years, Sawsan's husband has also operated a taxi that takes internal and external requests. The taxi business has been profitable. 

Sawsan is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of licensing and insuring the taxi. This will make the taxi legal to work and improve the family's income. Sawsan is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and insuring the taxi

loans.name: Ghislain

texts.fr:
Client de 36 ans maintenant, marié et père de 3 enfants dont l'age varient entre 6 et 12 ans, il se lance dans le commerce spécialement la vente des filets d'oignons et de filets d'ails.
Ce client a deja bénéficié de 3 cycles de prêts , il a grandement élargi son activité , sa capacité de vente a largement évolué, il a des fait d'importantes d'épargnes et a rembourse ses différents prêts sans difficultés.
Deux fois par semaine , il va s'approvisionner a Kinshasa et la veille , il vend sa marchandise en gros auprès de ses fidèles clients.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il a l'intention d'acheter des 40 filets d'oignons et 25 filets d'ails , il a ouvert un dépôt pour commencer la vente en gros des ses filets  dans la parcelle familiale situe non loin du marche.
Ce client est très entreprenant il continue a persévérer dans le meme processus
texts.en:
This client is 36 years old now, married, and has three children whose ages range from 6 to 12 years old. He started in the business of selling mesh bags of onions and garlic.
This client has already benefited from three loan cycles, and has significantly expanded his business. His sales capacity has developed widely, he has built up considerable savings, and he has repaid his loans without difficulty.
Twice a week, he goes to get his supplies in Kinshasa; on the days preceding his trips, he sells his merchandise in bulk to his faithful customers.
With this new loan, he intends to buy 40 mesh bags of onions and 25 mesh bags of garlic. He has opened a depot on his family's plot of land located near the market in order to sell his goods in bulk.
This client is very enterprising and continues to adhere to his previous business practices.

loans.use: to buy 40 mesh bags of onions and 25 mesh bags of garlic.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 37-year-old mother of a son and daughter, and her husband has a store selling fruits and vegetables, the only source of income for the family. Hanan wants to help her husband purchase large quantities of fruits and vegetables to sell in order to increase the family's income, and so is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN for this purpose.

Hanan is a conservative woman, so her husband was photographed in his store in her place.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is a farmer from Norashen village. He lives with his wife, mother, and children. 

Artak has been running his farm for 7 years and has supported his family by the income from agriculture. Now Artak has applied for a loan to develop it. 

With this loan he plans to purchase fertilizer, which is very important for successful cultivation of the land. This will allow Artak to get more income and expand his farm further.

loans.use: to pay for fertlizer.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.fr:
Client de 38 ans, toujours marie et père de deux enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 9 ans. Il se lance dans la vente des cartes prépayées en 2005 et a l'heure actuelle il est très content parce qu'il est très autonome et il ne dépend plus de ses fournisseurs,il a la capacité d'acheter en gros des cartes de differents réseaux.
Ses ventes ont largement augmentes en moyenne il a par jour 100.000 frs a 150.000 frs par jour.
A l'octroi de son nouveau prêt, il va encore renforcer son stock en achetant des cartes MTN, Airtel, Azur et Warid et renouveler son abonnement de Congo Telecom.
Tres pragmatique, il est agrandi son commerce et a l'intention d'ouvrir une autre cabine téléphonique et toujours pour atteindre ses objectifs , il continue a épargner pour acheter une voiture  taxi pour faire le transport en commun.
texts.en:
This client is 38 years old, still married, and has two children aged 5 and 9. He began selling prepaid phone cards in 2005 and currently he is very happy because he is very independent and no longer relies on his suppliers, since he has the capacity to buy phone cards from different providers in bulk.
His sales have significantly increased and he earns between 100,000 and 150,000 Frs. per day.
Upon the granting of this new loan, he is going to further strengthen his stock by buying MTN, Airtel, Azur, and Warid cards and renewing his subscription to Congo Telecom.
Very pragmatic, he has expanded his business and intends to open another telephone booth. Still aiming to achieve his goals, he continues to save for a taxi cab in order to provide public transportation services.

loans.use: to buy prepaid Airtel, MTN, Warid, Azur and Congo Telecom cards.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is engaged in agriculture. He keeps cattle and cultivates land. Artak lives with his parents, who help him to keep the farm. 

Artak has applied for a loan to expand his farm. He plans to purchase two cows, as well as forage for the cattle. The expansion of his farm will help Artak to increase his income, which he plans to invest in the development of agriculture in the future.

loans.use: to pay for cows and forage.

loans.name: Kivisi

texts.en:
Kivisi is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 6 months to 15 years. He describes himself to be determined, patient and God-fearing. 

He operates a hardware where he sells drills, pipes, voltage regulators, etc. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are new and repeat customers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation when delivering the equipment to customers. He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy drills, voltage regulators and fault detectors. His business goal is to be a contractor dealing with the electricity within five years.

loans.use: To buy drills, voltage regulators and fault detectors.

loans.name: C5692 Abadacogora Group

texts.en:
Florence is 31 years old and is a married with three children between the ages of 9 and 12 years old. She sells sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, beans, and sorghum. Her business is open from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. She currently employs one person to help her. 

Florence is the leader of the group called "C5692 Abadacogora" in the local language. She is the first person on the right side of the picture. She has five years of experience. 

Florence has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, beans, and sorghum to sell. With this profit, she will be able to reinvest in her business, renovate her house, and pay her childrens' school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, beans, and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: C5690 Zamuka Group

texts.en:
Syverien is 31 years old and is married with one child who is 1 year old. His business is well organized. He sells sorghum, beans, and maize in the market and he works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. Syverien employs one people to help him. 

Syverien has requested a loan from a Kiva lender in order to purchase more quantities of sorghum, beans, and maize to sell. With this profit, Syverien will be able to buy more quantities of food for his family, reinvest in his business, and pay his child's school fees.

loans.use: to parchase more sorghum, beans, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He packs and sells spices. He has good number of business contacts and earns reasonably good profits from his business every month.

With this loan investment, Shaheen's husband will buy different spices that he will pack and then sell to different shopkeepers and grocery store owners for profit.

Shaheen is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has good sewing skills and receives regular orders every month. She has given birth to 4 sons and 2 daughters. Her second son is a salesman, while three of her remaining children are getting their education. Shaheen is hopeful that her husband will make good use of the loan money and increase his income.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shaheen.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell for profit.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 43 years old.  She is married and has two sons, both of whom study in a nearby school.  Her eldest son also operates a business, selling fertilizers after returning home from school.  Shahnaz’s husband operates an auto workshop in the market.  He is very skillful and known as an expert in his work.

Shahnaz is a housewife and she stays at home to manage the household responsibilities.  She is very efficient and tries to provide comfort to her family by cooking food for them and by managing her household work and expenses in an efficient manner.  She has applied for a loan for her husband from KIVA partner Asasah.  With this loan, he will buy tools that will allow him to offer higher quality auto repair services to his customers and increase his income.  He is very experienced in his work and Shahnaz is hopeful that this investment in his business will be a productive one for him.

Note:  In the photo, the lady holding a book titled "Asasah Passbook" is Shahnaz.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's auto repair business.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. She started her business a few years ago to financially support her husband who is a rickshaw driver, providing transport services to his passengers.  With this loan, Bushra will buy a new sewing machine to replace her current machine that has become unreliable, making it difficult for her to meet order deadlines.  By purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to finish orders on time and increase her profits.

Bushra is very efficient and is transferring her skills to her elder daughter by teaching her the art of sewing, enabling her to earn some income every month.  Bushra’s other two daughters stay at home and help Bushra in her household tasks.  Bushra’s eldest son is a painter and paints walls and buildings.

Note:  In the photo, the lady holding a book entitled Asasah Passbook is Bushra.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is a young mother of one daughter who is not yet of school age.  She has been working on her rice farm and cassava field for two years as her main source of income.  She earns additional income to support her family by working for others. 

Pheap took her first loan with VisionFund in 2010 and the loan has helped her improve her family’s living conditions by enabling her to afford sufficient food to eat.  She now earns around $4 per day to feed her family.  After fully repaying her first loan, she is applying for another loan with two new members who have just joined VisionFund for this loan cycle.  As the leader of the group, she will use this entire loan to buy seed and fertilizer for her rice farm.  She hopes to increase crop yield, enabling her to earn a good profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for for her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Srouy's Group

texts.en:
Srouy is 59 years old.  She is married and has six children, two of whom are dependent on her.  She is a rice farmer in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia and she has been farming her own farmland for almost 40 years to earn a living.  To earn additional income to better feed her family, she also grows vegetables.  With her current business, she earns about $5 per day to pay for daily household expenses.

Srouy is the leader of the five-member Srouy Group and this is their first loan with Kiva's field partner VisionFund.  As the leader, Srouy will use this loan to buy more seed and fertilizer for her farmland.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more seed and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is 25 years old and is originally from a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia.  She is married and has two dependent children, one son and one daughter who both attend school.  For the past eight years, Hoeurn has operated a business, farming rice and cassava to earn a living. In addition, she sometimes works for others for a fee to better pay for her family's daily expenses.  She earns around $4 per day from her current business and is able to save $3 each day. 

Hoeurn’s group consists of two female members.  They have both recently joined with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, for this loan cycle.  As the leader of the group, Hoeurn will use this loan to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to produce more healthy cassava, increasing her family’s income and keeping her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymon, 28, is a married mother of a daughter and son who are still too young to attend school. Residing in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia where crop farming is a common source of family income, Sreymom and her husband plant cassava as their main business and sometimes work for others in the village. They earn about US$15 per day and are able to save about US$10 each day.

Sreymon received a loan from VisionFund three years ago, since repaid, which improved her living conditions. Now requesting another loan, she will use it to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for the labor involved in planting cassava. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase their cassava yield, send the children to school, and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor required for planting cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
A farmer in a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Pov is a 40-year-old mother of two dependent daughters who are still in school. She has been farming her own land as her main source of income for nearly 18 years. To better pay for daily expenses such food and her children’s education, she sometimes works for others for pay in her village. Now with her hard work, she manages to earn around US$4 per day and is able to save around US$2.50 each day. 

Pov has been with VisionFund since 2010. Now applying for another loan with VisionFund, she plans to use the entire loan of KHR1,500,000 to buy a few piglets for her new income-generating business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to start up her pig-raising business successfully and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy piglets for a new income-generating business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 33, is a married mother of one dependent daughter who is still in school. Living in an area of the Ponhea Krek district, where crop farming is common, Mom has been farming her own land for two years. In addition to her main business, she also leases a small plot of land where she plants cassava and she sometimes works for others to earn more income to better feed her family. She currently earns more than US$5 per day from her business and is able to save US$3 each day. 

This is Mom’s first loan with Kiva's field partner VisionFund. She plans to use this loan to pay for the lease fee and to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to produce healthier cassava and set aside some money to own a small cassava farm in the future.

loans.use: to pay the lease fee and buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. She will use the loan money to purchase a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete her orders on time and earn higher profits.

Her husband makes plastic bottles on order. Saima has a 3-year-old daughter who is not yet of school-going age. She is confident that by investing the loan, she will be able to increase her income, which will help her to save some money for her daughter's future school fees.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a passbook (called the Asasah Passbook) is Saima.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Aged 35, Hun is a married mother of three dependent daughters. Two of them are still in school while the last one is not yet old enough to attend school. She lives in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, where crop farming is a common source of family income. Like other villagers, Hun and her husband plant cassava as their main business, and they have been in this business for five years. Sometimes, they both work for others for pay to earn more income. Now she earns US$5 per day from her current business and is able to save US$2.50 each day

This is Hun's first loan with Kiva's field partner VisionFund. As the leader of her group, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her cassava yield, improve her lifestyle, and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Sokea (in the photo) and her husband are vegetable farmers who raise pigs at home. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have three children – two sons and one daughter. 

Sokea wants to raise cows, so she has decided to apply for a loan of $700. She will also use a part of the loan to buy one more sow for her pig farming business.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a sow to raise.

loans.name: Sinoeurn

texts.en:
The breadwinner of a family located in a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, Sinoeurn is a 35-year-old mother of three dependent sons who are still in school. Like other villagers in her village, rice and cassava farming have been the main source of income for the family for more than four years. She earns about US$10 per day from her current business and manages to save around US$5 each day. 

Sinoeurn has just joined with VisionFund this loan cycle. She plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase cassava yield and earn a larger income to improve her lifestyle and also keep her sons in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than (in the photo) is a weaver. Her husband, Khan, is a television and radio repairman. Than also buys cotton and silk products from weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces. She is asking for another loan of $500 to buy more cotton and silk fabrics for resale. 

Than and her husband have been married since 1979 and live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy cotton and silk fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Hauy

texts.en:
Hauy and his wife, Sopheap, have been farming for almost 30 years and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, another one is a garment worker, and the others attend school. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Hauy and his wife are vegetable farmers. He is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his farm and to repair the house where he lives.

Photo: Hauy is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his farm and to repair his house.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is married and is 53 years of age. She sells wool in order to afford the living expenses of her family. Wool is used in making sweaters and other winter clothes. She has given birth to 2 sons. Both of them work and contribute to the family financially.

Farzana has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her wool-selling business. With the loan investment, she will buy wool in bulk quantities, which will allow her to sell in larger quantities and increase her sales and profits.

The winter season is here, and the demand for wool is high. Farzana is hopeful that by investing the loan she will be able to increase her income.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Farzana.

loans.use: to buy wool in larger quantities for her wool-selling business.

loans.name: You Sos

texts.en:
You Sos is a fisherman, while his wife, Mary, sells fish that her husband catches to the wholesaler in the village. In addition, You Sos also drives a motor taxi when he is not busy fishing. 

Unfortunately, he got into an accident and his motorbike was damaged. You Sos decided to sell the motorbike. Now that he has recovered (as shown in the photo), he wants to buy another motorbike in order to resume his motor taxi business. He is asking for a loan of $800 to make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to drive as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Chorvy's Group

texts.en:
Chorvy is a resident in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia where crop farming is a common way to make a living. She is 49 years old and has five children, two of whom (one son and one daughter) are dependents working in Thailand for pay. She and her husband are farmers and rice farming has been their main source of family income for more than fifteen years.

Chorvy’s group consists of three female members. She has been with VisionFund for five years, while the other two members have been with VisionFund from three to five years. Since her 2006 loan, she has been enabled to support basic household needs regularly and raise pigs as an additional income source. She currently earns around US $18 per day but is able to save less than US $2 each day. 

Now she is leading this group to apply for another loan with VisionFund for KHR 1,400,000 each. As the leader, she will use this loan to pay for labor to harvest her rice crop. This loan will enable her to increase her rice stock for sale and daily consumption. She hopes to earn a larger income so as to set aside some money to afford some household comforts, and also to build a house for her daughter in the future.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest her rice crop.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is the breadwinner of the family in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Touch is a 40-year-old mother of five sons, three of whom work for others for pay, while the other two are still too young to attend school. She and her husband are farmers who have been farming rice on their own farmland for more than twenty years. Sometimes they work for others for extra income.

Touch’s group consists of two female members. She has been with VisionFund for three years, while her group member has been with VisionFund for one year. Since 2008, a loan has helped her support her basic household needs regularly. She currently earns more than US $25 per day. 

Now requesting another loan with VisionFund, she will use this loan to pay for labor in harvesting her rice crop. This loan will enable her to increase her rice stock for sale and daily consumption. She hopes to earn a larger income so as to set aside some money for house renovation and also send her little children to school regularly.

loans.use: to pay for labor in harvesting her rice crop.

loans.name: Rours

texts.en:
Rours is 35 years old and her husband, Chea, is 32 years old. They live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have one young daughter.  

Rours and her husband are farmers. In addition, Rours’s husband is also a fisherman. Rours is asking for her first loan of $500 for buying fertilizer and pesticide to assist in her rice farming. 

Photo: Rours, her husband, and their daughter.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticide to assist in her farming.

loans.name: Goni's Group

texts.en:
Goni is 54 years old and a mother of a 12-year-old son. She was not able to provide an education for her son due to financial constraints. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her family business of selling animals. She operates this business with her husband. With the loan investment, she will buy a buffalo for selling to butchers or other buyers. She will also sell its milk to her community clients in order to earn higher profits. Along with her husband, she has been operating this business for the past many years and is confident that the loan investment will help her earn more profits from her business.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Goni.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Bambu Elok Group

texts.en: Mariam is pictured in the middle wearing a blue shirt. She is 51 years old. She has two children. She has been selling soft drinks, pop ice, nasi uduk (Indonesian coconut rice) and fried snacks for four years. Her business is going well. With her income, she can subsidize the income her husband earns as a part-time laborer to fulfill their daily basic needs. She is taking a loan from VisionFund Indonesia to buy rice and coconut to produce more nasi uduk and fried snacks to sell in her kiosk. One part that she likes in running this business is when she serves people. She has a simple hope, which is that her business always runs smoothly. In the future, she hopes that she can repair her house and have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for more rice and coconut

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Nan, 37, is a mother of two dependent children who are still in school. Her main source of income is cassava and rice farming, while her husband works in Phnom Penh. She has been in this business for 12 years to support her family.

Nan has been with VisionFund for two years and she successfully repaid the loan with VisionFund. She currently earns around US$14 per day to feed her children. Now she and two other members in her group are requesting another loan with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more yield so as to earn good profits to set aside some money for a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Caken Cwg Group

texts.en:
Indasah is pictured on the right wearing an orange shirt. She is married. She is a mother of four children. Indasah has been selling daily basic needs like rice, oil, eggs and sugar from her house since 2009. Her business started with only selling noodles, but then she added more variety of daily basic needs like rice, eggs and sugar. She wants to take her first loan from VisionFund Indonesia to buy more rice, sugar, coffee and noodles to sell. Income from her husband as a construction laborer plus her income can cover the family's daily needs. In the future, she wants to add more variety of goods in her store. She likes to run this business because she can help her husband to provide income while she doing housekeeping. She realizes that she needs more capital to have more inventory to sell.

Other group members use their part of loan to sell clothes on credit, cell phone minute refills, tea bottles and fried snacks and to service electronic goods.

loans.use: to pay for more rice, sugar, coffee, and noodles

loans.name: Innocent

texts.fr:
Innocent est né au Rwanda. Il a 43 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 2 à 17 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Innocent est agriculteur. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, des engrais chimiques et payement de la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture en utilisant des semences sélectionnées. Dans les prochaines années, Innocent voudrait  un agriculteur professionnel et être un distributeur des produits agricole. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Innocent was born in Rwanda.  He is 43 years old and has six children, ranging from 2 to 17 years.  Four of his children attend school.  Innocent is educated up to the third year of secondary school and works as a farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is planning to use this loan to buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, and to pay for labor.  In order to develop his business, his strategy is to modernize his farming business by using selected seeds.  In the coming years, Innocent would like to become a professional farmer and a distributor of agricultural products.  He is planning to use his profits to send his children to school and to improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.fr:
Bonaventure est né au Rwanda. Il a 60 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 33 à 35 ans, ils ont tous termine leurs études. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de primaire.

Bonaventure est agriculteur. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, des engrais chimiques et payement de la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la sélection des semences des qualités. Dans les prochaines années, Bonaventure voudrait  un agriculteur professionnel et être un distributeur des produits agricole. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de scolariser ses petits fils et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Bonaventure was born in Rwanda and is 60 years old.  He is married and has two children who are 33 and 35 years old.  Both his children have completed their studies.  Bonaventure is educated up to the third year of primary school and works as a farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  With this loan, he is planning to buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, and to pay for labor.  In order to develop his business, his strategy is to select high quality seeds.  In the coming years, Bonaventure would like to become a professional farmer and a distributor of agricultural products. He is planning to use his profits to send his grandsons to school and to improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
Thérèse  est née au Rwanda. Elle a 48 ans et elle est mariée avec 4 enfants de 7 à 19 ans,dont tous 4 sont  scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 2 ans de secondaire.

Thérèse est commerçante. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter en gros des charbons des bois pour les revendre dans les marchés locale et payer le transport de ces charbons.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de distribuer des charbons de qualité dans sa région. Dans les prochaines années, Thérèse voudrait être une grande distributrice de charbon dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit  de scolariser ses enfants, améliore le bien être de sa famille et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Thérèse, age 48, was born in Rwanda. She's married and has two children, aged 33 to 35, out of whom four attended school. Her own level of education amounts to two years of middle school.

Thérèse is a merchant who is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. She will use it to buy charcoal wholesale and to pay for its transportation. She will then resell it on local markets.

Her strategy for growing her business is to distribute quality charcoal in her region. In the forthcoming years, Thérèse would like to become a large charcoal distributor in her region.

With her profits, she intends to send her children to school, improve her family's well-being, and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal wholesale and pay for its transporation

loans.name: Merpati Utara Group

texts.en:
Siti is 33 years old. She is married with two children. Siti has been selling rice and fried snacks for three years. She has a kiosk in front of the elementary school. Her business is going well because children like to have snacks on their break time. When there is an exam week or long school vacation, she earns less income. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to buy more "aci" (a type of flour) to produce "cireng" (an Indonesian fried snack), rice, ice and noodles to sell. In the future she plans to expand her business and give her children a better education than she received. 

Other group members are selling gado-gado (Indonesian mixed vegetables with peanut sauce), clothes on credit and Tupperware on credit.

loans.use: to pay for "aci" (a type of flour), rice ice and noodles.

loans.name: Sean's Group

texts.en:
Sean, 51, is a married mother of four children, one of whom is a dependent daughter who is still in school. Sean and her husband are farmers who have been farming rice and planting cassava as their primary business to earn a living. They have been in this business for five years. To better support her living, she also raises pigs and sells cakes as secondary sources of income. With her hard work, she manages to earn around US$14 each day to feed her family. 

This is the first loan for Sean's group with VisionFund. Her group consists of three members. As the leader of the group, she plans to use this entire loan to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to make more cassava and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is very cooperative and supports her family by working as a farmer. She is still very efficient at the age of 57 and also performs her household duties very well. Her husband is a retired government servant and gets a pension from the government every month.

Naseem is the mother of a son and a daughter. Her son is a salesman, while her daughter stays at home and helps Naseem do her household duties.
Naseem has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her farming business. With the loan investment, she will buy farming supplies such as seeds and fertilizers, which will allow her to get maximum output from her land and increase her income.

Note: ”In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.”

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for farming business

loans.name: Alam's Group

texts.en:
Alam has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her farming business. With the loan investment, she will buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and seeds to grow better quality crops. She is an experienced person and confident that a loan investment will help her get more profits from her business.

Her husband does a job. Alam is the mother of a daughter who is 18 years old and stays at home and helps Alam in doing her household tasks. Alam is confident about the bright future of her family and is very sure that her improved business will allow her to save some money for the marriage of her daughter in near future.

Note: ”In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Alam.”

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for farming business

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 46-year-old man who is married with eight sons - six are school students. He is an employee that gets a decent salary and in addition, has a part-time job at night, but it is not enough to cover his family's needs and pay for education expenses. 

Nidal's son is studying at the university, specializing in Accounting. Nidal wants to help his son to complete his studies by paying for the university fees, so he is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help his son cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for his son and improve the family's living conditions. Nidal is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for university fees

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan stays at her home and performs her household duties. She is a very active and efficient lady and has raised her children with great care and effort. She has given birth to six sons and two daughters. Three of her sons operate a business selling chicken meat. The others are getting their education by attending a local school. Bashiraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for one of her son’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy chicken in larger quantities, which will allow him to fulfill his client’s orders on time and increase his income. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Bashiraan is confident about his business growth as a result of a loan investment.

NOTE: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Rawya

texts.en:
Rawya is a 31-year-old woman who is married and has two sons. Her husband is a construction worker with a decent salary, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs. Rawya wants to help her husband in purchasing a new construction kit to improve the quality of his work and so increase the family's income. 

Rawya is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new construction kit. This will improve his work and increase the family's income.

Rawya is a conservative woman, so her husband Wa'el is photographed in the construction workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new construction kit

loans.name: Hailen's Group

texts.en:
Hailen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business making and selling furniture. With the loan investment, he will buy wood and other raw materials for making better quality furniture and increase his income by selling it for more money. 

Hailen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a son and three daughters. Her eldest child is a teacher; the others are getting their education. Hailen is hopeful that her son will get maximum profits from his business by investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Hailen.

loans.use: To buy wood and other raw material for furniture making

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 44-year-old man, who is married with two sons and two daughters. He is an employee with a decent salary, but it is not enough to cover all of his family's needs and expenses. Mohammad wants to finish his house by completing tasks such as installing tiles and installing windows and doors to offer the family better living conditions. Mohammad is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of finishing the house and improving its condition. Mohammad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To finish his house.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is a 25-year-old single man. He is a bank employee. Yazan lives with his parents in the family house, and he wants to pay for repairs such as painting and changing windows and doors. However, his salary is not enough to cover all of these expenses. He is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of repairing the family house and improving its condition. This will provide the family with better living conditions. Yazan is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to the family house.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 53 ans. Il est marié à une coiffeuse avec 03 enfants en charge.
Koffi travaille comme revendeur de meubles neufs et occasions depuis 2006. Il exerce seul son activité dans la zone portuaire et achète à Lomé.
Koffi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des meubles pour mieux répondre à ses clients.
texts.en:
Koffi, age 53, is married to a hairdresser and has three children to support. He's been selling new and used furniture since 2006. He works alone in the harbor area, and gets his supplies in Lomé. 

Koffi is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to buy furniture and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy new and used furniture

loans.name: Alozouhoin

texts.fr:
Alozouhoin est une femme  âgé(e) de 45 ans. Elle est mariée à un menuisier et a 01 enfant.
Alozouhoin travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2004. Elle vend de façon ambulante et achète les pagnes au Grand Marché de Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est le fait de se promener pour satisfaire ses clients.
Alozouhoin a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Alozouhoin voudrait agrandir son commerce en ouvrant une boutique et assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en:
Alozouhoin is 45 years old. She is married to a carpenter and has one child.

Alozouhoin has been selling pagnes (traditional sarong-like clothing) since 2004. She is a street vendor and she gets her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market. Her principal challenge is all the walking she has to do in order to satisfy customer demand.

Alozouhoin is requesting her 3rd loan from WAGES so that she can buy some pagnes. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Alozouhoin would like to expand her business by opening her own shop, and ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy some pagnes.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik lives in Nor Sasnashen village with his wife and three children. He has been engaged in farming and cattle breeding for six years. Gagik has applied for this loan to develop his cattle breeding business in order to increase his income and ensure improved living conditions for his family. He plans to purchase cattle and forage with the loan.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

location.town: Nor Sasnashen village of Aragatsotn region

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgé(e) de 42 ans. Elle est mariée à un soudeur.  Elle a 02 enfants. Ablavi travaille comme coiffeuse et tresseuse  depuis 1991. Elle a un atelier dans un quartier de la place. En plus de son salon, elle vend des produits de beauté à ses clientes.
Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 42 years old. She is married to a welder and has 2 children.

Ablavi has been working as a hairdresser and braider since 1991. She has a studio in her local neighbourhood. As well providing hair salon services, she also sells her clients beauty products.

Ablavi is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy beauty products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 57 years old and is married with six children aged between 5 and 35 years old. Jean Damascene has ten years' experience selling various goods like tea, breads, sweets, and milk.

Jean Damascene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods such as tea, breads, sweets, and milk to sell. With any profits from the loan, he would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of tea, breads, sweets, milk and other items to sell.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives in Yerevan with her husband and son. For twelve years she has been running a bakery. Gayane has applied for this loan to expand her business. She plans to increase the variety of products she sells and to make the Armenian national bread, lavash, which is in great demand in the city. To achieve this goal Gayane plans to purchase a special machine to make lavash. Gayane also plans to renovate the bakery. This loan will help Gayane to develop her business and get more income, which is vital for her to ensure a better future for the family.

loans.use: to pay for a machine to make bread and for her bakery's renovation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 26 years old and married with one child, who is two years old. She owns a business where she sells tableware. This is her eighth year in the business. 

Immaculee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more tableware to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tableware to sell.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 37 years old and married with four children between the ages of 2 and 13 years old. He has one year of experience selling various beers such as Primus, Amstel, Mutzig, and Heineken. He currently employs one person to help him. 

Jean Damascene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various beers to sell. With any profits from the loan, Jean Damascene would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and to start saving for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer to sell.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana lives in Sisian with her husband, little son, and parents-in-law. She is engaged in farming and cattle breeding. Liana needs some financial investment to develop her cattle breeding business. With the requested loan she plans to purchase five cows and forage. This will allow Liana to increase her income from agriculture, which will allow her to improve her household conditions and ensure higher living standards for her family.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en: Emad is a 23-year-old single man. He is an employee of a local advertising company, but he does not earn enough to cover all of his expenses. Emad wants to improve his income by purchasing a new laptop to use for making designs to sell. Emad is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a laptop and improving the condition of his work. This will increase his sales and improve his income. Emad is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is 29 years old and a father with one son. He earns a decent salary but not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past 5 years, Ameen has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project.

Ameen is requesting a 2,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and improve the herd's condition.

loans.name: Nare

texts.en: Nare lives in Sisian with her husband and little child. Nare's husband is a contract military officer. Nare is engaged in agriculture. She keeps hens. Due to hard work and patience Nare has increased the number of hens to one hundred. Now Nare would like to develop other fields of agriculture, too. She plans to purchase livestock and forage and get engaged in cattle breeding. This loan will help Nare to get additional income and insure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase olive and almond seedlings

loans.name: Artem

texts.en: Artem lives in Yerevan with his wife and two school-age children. He is a taxi driver who rents a car to drive. Artem wants to purchase his own car, which will allow him not to pay for the rented car and get more income. This loan will help Artem to purchase the car and drive it as a taxi. With a new car, Artem will provide services with higher quality for his clients and attract new ones.

loans.use: to pay for a car

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 40 year-old single man — a worker with low income. His sister has a sewing workshop. Mohammad wants a loan of 2,000 USD from FATEN to help him cover the costs to complete finishing his house such as: painting, installing tiles, installing windows and doors. This will create better living conditions for him.

loans.use: To complete finishing the house

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en: Hakob is a 36-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. He lives with his wife and two daughters. Hakob runs a shop where he trades with construction materials. Hakob has applied for this loan to increase the variety of products at his shop. With the loan's help, he will purchase more construction materials and meet the clients' demands. Hakob will increase the business income and invest in the shop's further expansion.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials

loans.name: Bethsebah

texts.en:
Bethsebah is a single mother of two and lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She has owned a tailoring shop for seven years. She was first employed as a tailor and saved some money before moving on to start her own business enterprise.

After being introduced to Milango, Bethsebah is asking for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase textile materials to make clothes. Her future ambitions include selling readymade clothes and curtains. Bethsebah’s business faces the challenge of finding customers and some of them not paying on time. She will save the extra income for future use.

loans.use: to purchase textile materials to make clothes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has a grocery stall that has been in operation for three years. This venture was started from his savings. After being introduced to Milango by his friends, Daniel is applying for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a motorcycle. 

His business faces the challenge of high inflation, which has reduced purchasing power of most customers and the seasonality of the business. He intends to use the extra income to meet other family needs.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: At Taufiq Utara 2 Group

texts.en:
Indah is married with two children. She has been selling clothes on credit for six years. She goes around her neighborhood to sell clothes. The business is going well. Now she also receives orders from her customers. Income from her business can help her to provide food for the family, because her husband is a laborer on a big ship and comes home when the ship comes back. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to buy t-shirts, housedresses, and pants to sell on credit. In the future, she wants to sell clothes for cash, not just on credit. She hopes she can send her children to reach higher education and have a degree from the University.

Other group members are also selling clothes on credit and fried snacks.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell on credit

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en: Stepan is a school teacher and lives with his wife, who is also a teacher. The family has been engaged in beekeeping for five years. Stepan has applied for this loan to develop his beekeeping. He plans to purchase 15 more beehives, which will allow him to receive more honey. Honey is in great demand not only in the city, but also in the region, so meeting this demand will allow Stepan to increase his income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en: Nune runs an Arabian cafe-restaurant “ARABICA” in Yerevan, a business she started in 2010. Nune sells Arabian cocktails, coffee, nargiles (hookah pipes) and so on. She has applied for a loan before, which was successfully paid off. Now, Nune has applied for this loan to enlarge her business and to increase her product assortment. This loan will help her to meet client demand and increase the business income.

loans.use: to pay for products for her cafe.

loans.name: Wijdan

texts.en: Wijdan, 59, is a mother with five sons and one daughter. Some of her sons are Palestinian National Authority employees with decent salaries but her husband is a blacksmith and his low income is not enough to cover the family's needs. Wijdan's husband wants to improve the quality of his work by purchasing new blacksmith tools. Therefore, Wijdan is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of these new tools. This will improve his work, increase sales and improve the family's income. Wijdan is a conservative woman, so her son Hisham is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase new blacksmith tools.

loans.name: Aghasi

texts.en: Aghasi trades clothing from a rented booth in the city market. He would like to increase his sales and develop his business. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase clothing to sell. This loan will help him to expand his business and to get more income, with which he will ensure a prosperous life for his family. Aghasi lives with his parents and his sister, who is a student.

loans.use: to pay for clothing.

loans.name: Gaudance

texts.en:
Gaudance, 38, is married. She has five years of experience selling African clothes and currently employs one person to help her.

Gaudance has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more African clothes to sell. With any profits from the loan, Gaudance would like to satisfy her family's basic needs and to start saving for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more African clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes as inventory for a small retail shop

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married, and has  five children. He owns a small shop where he sells soap, bread, rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar and so on. This is his fifth year in business and he works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. 

Joseph has requested a this loan through Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company to buy more cooking oil, bread, books, and soap to sell. He plans to revinvest any profits back into his business and wants to be able to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, bread, books, and soap

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is a seamstress who lives in Yerevan with her husband and son. She has had her business for ten years, and plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy fabric for her business. She needs the new fabric to be able to finish orders for her clients and to get new orders.

Sonya hopes she will be able to grow her business and get more income, which will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and make it easier for her to make ends meet.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis is a young farmer form Agarakadzor Village who lives with his parents and sister. For many years his family has been breeding cattle, which is their main source of income.

Aramayis has applied for this loan in order to expand his farm.  With the proceeds of the loan, he plans to purchase two cows and a calf. He hopes that breeding the cattle will allow him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.  He plans to start his own family in the future.

loans.use: To buy cows and a calf

location.town: Agarakadzor village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is a beekeeper who has five beehives. His current income from beekeeping is barely enough to pay for his family's living expenses.

Artak lives with his father, wife and son.  He would like to expand his farm and earn more income. With the help of this loan Artak plans to purchase 15 more beehives. He hopes that expanding his beekeeping operations will allow him to make his farm more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy beehives

loans.name: Benik

texts.en: Benik is a 52-year-old farmer from Kechut village. He lives with his wife and son. Benik has been engaged in cattle breeding for many years, and he has managed to increase the number of cattle to thirteen. Now Benik would like to develop his farm further. With the help of this loan he plans to purchase five cows. With the increased number of cattle, Benik will get more income from the sale of milk and meat and ensure a stable future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cows.

location.town: Kechut village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Sevada

texts.en: Sevada is a 26-year-old farmer. He lives with his mother and his father, who is a teacher at the local school. Sevada has applied for this loan to develop cattle breeding. With the requested loan he plans to purchase two cows and forage. Sevada plans to start his own family, so with increased income from agriculture he will ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cows.

location.town: Yelpin village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing and embroidery business. With the loan investment, she will buy a sewing machine and larger quantities of some embroidery materials such as beads and thread. This will allow her to improve her business conditions and increase her sales and profits.

Sewing and embroidery is a very common profession among ladies and there is a lot of competition. Yasmeen has been operating her business for many years, and she is confident about her success as a result of loan investment.

Her husband is an electrician by profession while her eldest son has a business selling medicine.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and embroidery materials.

loans.name: Dilshad's Group

texts.en:
Dilshad is 31 years old and married. She supports her family by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful and has great creative sense in her work. Due to her high-quality work, she receives regular orders every month.

Dilshad is the mother of 2 sons, the eldest one studies in class 2 while her younger son is only 2 years old. Her husband works at a bus station.

Dilshad has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has become rough and needs replacement. With the new sewing machine, she will be able to complete her orders on time and earn more profits. She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that a new sewing machine will help her to make her business better.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Mawussé

texts.fr:
Mawussé est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un gestionnaire. Elle a un enfant. 
Mawussé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle vend des tissus bazin pour tous clients à de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire la demande de tous clients.
MAwussé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus bazin. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Mawussé voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mawussé is 29 years old. She is married to an administrator and has one child.

Mawussé has been working as a reseller since 2011. She is a street vendor and sells damask cloth to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Her principal challenge at this time is that she is not able to satisfy all her customers´ demands.

Mawussé is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can restock on damask cloth. She would like to reinvest in her business. 

In the coming years, Mawussé would like to expand her business activity. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy damask cloth.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her blanket-selling business. She supplies blankets to different shops and also to her community clients. With the loan investment, she will buy larger quantities of blankets, allowing her to meet the demand from her clients and increase her income.

She is very experienced in her work and has been operating her business for many years. She is very confident that her business will grow further after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady who has raised her hand is Riffat.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell.

loans.name: Nayelya

texts.en:
Nayelya lives with her husband and two sons. Nayelya and her husband are both teachers at the local school, as well as running a farm, where they keep cows and sheep. 

Nayelya would like to expand her farm, thus she has applied for a loan. With the loan's help she plans to purchase cattle. Nayelya plans to develop her farm, increasing the income. This will allow her to ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for cattle.

loans.name: Vitalik

texts.en: Vitalik is a 30-year-old farmer. He lives with his wife and three children. Vitalik has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle he has and to develop cattle breeding. This will allow him to get more income and invest it in the farm's further expansion in the future. Besides, Vitalik will be able to make savings to invest in his children's education in the future.

loans.use: to pay for cattle.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 21 years old. He lives with his mother and brother. Samson is involved in cattle breeding.

Samson would like to expand his farm and develop his cattle breeding. To get sufficient financial means, he has applied for a loan. With the requested loan, Samson plans to purchase cows. Expansion of the farm will allow Samson to get more income and insure improved living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cows

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik is involved in agriculture. She keep cattle and cultivates land. Satik has applied for a loan to expand her farm. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase three cows and forage (feed).

An expansion of the farm will allow Satik to increase her income from agriculture and improve her family's living conditions. Satik lives with her husband and son.

loans.use: to pay for cows and forage

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a conservative woman, so her husband Faiyeq is photographed instead in the FATEN branch. Jameela is a 60-year-old woman and is the mother of six sons and five daughters. Her husband gets a pension, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs and expenses.

Jameela wants to purchase new home furniture so as to live in better home conditions, things such as living room furniture, dinning room furniture, etc., but since the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing home furniture and improving the house's condition. This will offer better living conditions to the family.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Filomaine

texts.fr:
Filomaine est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un blanchisseur. Elle a trois enfants.
Filomaine travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1999. Elle  vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Filomaine a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Filomaine voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille
texts.en:
Filomaine, age 37, is married to a laundry worker and has three children. She's been working as a reseller since 1999.

She sells general food products to any customer at her home and works alone. She purchases her supplies in Lomé.

At this time, her main difficulty is that she is out of stock. She's seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy general food products.

She wants to reinvest in her business. In the forthcoming years, Filomaine would like to expand her business. She says that she intends to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 29-year-old young woman and is married with four daughters. Her husband works in furniture making with a low income which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Rasha wants to improve the family's income and share the expenses of life with her husband by having her own project, which is a beauty salon. She is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new beauty salon equipment such as hair dryers, a collection of hair brushes, hair and body creams, etc. This will improve her work and increase the family's income.

Rasha is a conservative woman, so her husband Ramzi is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Sevada

texts.en:
Sevada is a 24-year-old farmer. He lives with his wife and child.

Sevada would like to expand his farm, so he has applied for a loan. Sevada plans to purchase a cow and forage (feed). Expansion of the farm will allow Sevada to sell more milk and increase his income, which is vital for him to insure a brighter future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is 31 years old and married with two children aged 2 and 4. He sells water to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has employed two people. He also runs a retail shop to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income, and he hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a water tank.

loans.use: To buy  a water tank.

loans.name: Shehadeh

texts.en: Shehadeh is a 26-year-old young man. He is engaged and will get married soon. He is a worker with a decent salary, but it is not enough to cover his needs and wedding expenses. Shehadeh is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the expenses needed to prepare well for his wedding, such as purchasing necessary home furniture and appliances. This will help Shehadeh to feel comfortable and enjoy his wedding. Shehadeh is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay his wedding expenses.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur is a 35-year-old retailer from Armavir. He trades clothing in the city market. Artur has applied for a loan to increase his inventory. With the loan's help, he plans to purchase more clothing to sell. Artur will increase his sales, which will allow him to get more income. With additional income, Artur will ensure more prosperous living conditions for his family. Artur lives with his wife and two children.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ablamvi

texts.fr:
Ablanvi est un homme âgé de 27 ans. Il est célibataire. 
Ablanvi travaille comme coiffeur depuis 2007. Il coiffe tous les clients dans son atelier. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients.
Ablanvi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des outils de travail et aménager son atelier. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ablanvi voudrait ouvrir un autre atelier.
texts.en:
Ablanvi, age 27, is single. He's been a hairdresser since 2007. He does all his customer's hairstyling in his salon, where he works alone.

At this time, his main difficulty is being unable to meet customer demand. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to purchase hairdressing tools and fix up his hair salon.

He wants to reinvest in his business. In the forthcoming years, he would like to open another salon.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools and fix up his hair salon

loans.name: Midji Koffi

texts.fr:
Midji Koffi est un homme âgé de 37 ans. Il est marié å un/e couturière. Il a 01enfant.
Midji Koffi travaille comme revendeur de cassettes depuis 2010. Il exerce seul son activité dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé et achéte ses marchandises à Lomé. 
Midji Koffi a requis son cycle de prêt crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cassettes.
Dans les prochaines années, Midji Koffi voudrait avoir une boutique pour répondre plus à la demande de la clientèle. Et pour mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Midji Koffi is a 37-year-old man. He is married to a seamstress. He has one child.

Midji Koffi has been selling cassette tapes since 2010. He runs his business by himself in a neighborhood of Lomé, and he buys his products in Lomé.

Midji Koffi is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to buy cassette tapes.

In the coming years, Midji Koffi would like to have a shop in order to better meet the demand of his customers, and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy cassette tapes

loans.name: Kangni

texts.fr:
Kangni est un homme âgé de 59 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a trois enfants.  
Kangni travaille comme revendeur depuis 2006. Il vend des cartes de recharge pour tous clients en ambulant. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire toute la  demande.
Kangni a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kangni voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kangni is a 59-year-old man. He is married to a retailer. He has three children.

Kangni has been working as a retailer since 2006. He sells calling cards door-to-door to a wide array of customers. He buys his products in Lomé. He works by himself. Currently, the biggest challenge for him is not being able to meet all of the demand.

Kangni is asking for his first loan from WAGES in order to buy calling cards. He wants to reinvest in his business.

In the coming years, Kangni would like to grow his business. He says that with the profits, he plans to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy calling cards

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz Elena ha trabajado toda su vida en el sector de la confección, y gracias a la experiencia que adquirió sus productos son muy apetecidos por su buena calidad.
Desde muy joven Beatriz Elena comenzó a trabajar con su familia en un taller de confección, y hace aproximadamente 7 años decidió montar su propio taller de confección y dedicarse al servicio de confección a terceros. Desde entonces esta es su fuente de ingresos y con esto ayuda al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. 
Beatriz Elena es muy reconocida en su sector por ser una persona muy amable y trabajadora, y todo esto le ha ayudado a que sus clientes sean fieles a sus productos. Beatriz Elena tiene el gran sueño de que su taller crezca y se pueda expandir, para poder generar empleo y colaborarle a las demás personas mejorándoles su calidad de vida.
